products.name: Pipewriter - Wireframes in Google Docs
products.description:
10√ó Your Copy Decks, Right Where You Write

Great products start with writing. So, here's everyone's favorite(ish) text editor hacked into a design/wireframing app.

‚Äî for copywriters, UX writers, content strategists and curious designers who understand that words are the heart of product development.


‚Äúdelivering $10k projects faster‚Äù and ‚Äúraising your rates with pro-level wireframes.‚Äù

Everything you need to create lovely writing-first wireframes

  • Template docs system
  • Native sidebar app
  • 84+ pre-made UI elements
  • Guides, examples, video tutorials (WIP)

Think of it as a UI kit for Google Docs (if you're a designer), or a copy-paste portfolio & rate raising machine (if you're a web writer).

1Ô∏è‚É£ Native App ‚ö°Ô∏è

Build a full website wireframe in minutes. The app lives right in Google Docs and makes it do things the G-team never dreamed of:


  • Scaffold landing page in 2 minutes
  • Click-to-insert layouts
  • 34+ ready elements
  • Light/dark mode switching
  • Bound scripts in every doc (nerdy but important)


"I've never seen a tool like this. I've been building wireframes by hand using tables, even for five-figure contracts. This changes everything for UX writers."

‚Äî Eoin Cronolly, SaaS Copywriter

üíÖ Formatted Template Docs

Everything stays consistent so your wireframes look pro with zero manual effort:

  • Text styles with real hierarchy
  • One-click background color
  • Native dark mode (both app & docs)
  • Word count limits for UX and AI prompts


üîí Preview the Full Doc ->
it's locked ha ha ha

Why the Heck in Docs? ü§î

I mean... do you want to click 5 times in Figma to edit a headline?

If movie films can have proper screenplays üé¨, we deserve better than BUTTON: BuY NOw!!1! in our docs.


Great websites ($10k+) start with polished copy decks where every comma matters.

If you want the high cabbage, you need to provide

It has everything you need

  • Word count limits

  • Just a pinch of design thinking
  • World-class 1st impression

If movie films can have screenplays üé¨ why can't we go a bit fancier than BUTTON: BuY NOw!!1! and raise our rates.


Made for Fellow Writers

I built this to survive years of banging website copy for SaaS and startups.

It's my jar of hearts of Google Doc scripts, cleaned up and wrapped in a modern app.

ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Copywriters ‚Äî From $500 to $5k projects. High conversion landing pages

ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è UX Writers ‚Äî Visualize, write, repeat. Break into tech without Figma or code

ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Content writers & strategist ‚Äî Lead with content-first design

ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Designers ‚Äî Lots of you know me through Ran. Come on already, give UI-free wireframing a shot and stop polishing pixels before UX.

+

products.custom_summary: Write copy decks that look like $10k wireframes

products.name: Pipewriter BK
products.description:
10X Your Copy Decks... in Google Docs. UI kit + App for Writers

Just when you've thought you'd seen it all ‚Äî here's Google Docs hacked to bits to become a full-fledged wireframing app.

Why the heck in Docs? Because it's time We The Writers got fancy UX tools of our own.

(without learning to click around in Figma, VS Code, or Microsoft Paint Pro 4.1)

‚ú¶ Wireframes for Writers

If you've been doing copywriting, web content, UX writing... (or designing in a team with writers in it), you know the drill:

Every digital product starts with words.

- Movie films have screenplays
- Apps have user stories
- Websites have copy decks

The best web projects (think $10k+) start with writers who set the tone, voice, word counts, IA. Pretty pixels come after that.

[[ image or gif of workflow // Uploadcare example ]]



‚ú¶‚ú¶ Used by top SaaS & startups... sort of

Pipewriter was built by a longtime old-fart B2B SaaS copywriter (hi, I'm Ivan üëã) trying to speed up landing page wireframe writing for clients.

They seemed to like it, so I kept going, until this internal tool became good enough to share with you‚Äîmy fellow wordsmiths.

[logos]

‚ú¶ Sidebar in Google Docs (click-insert)

Developed in collaboration with NASA scientologists, the app runs in the Docs sidebar,

  • Apps Script bound to your document, and to any copies you make (if you choose so)
  • Latest updates: the app runs from our servers, so you always get the latest version of the GUI (on any number of docs)
  • More integrations coming: Figma, Webapp,

‚ú¶‚ú¶ 100+ UI elements (copy paste away)

Neatly formatted, packed and laid out template

  • Pre-formatted to look the part
  • UX optimized: minimal, clean design
  • Consistent text styles: update headings and body text and update the whole

[img elements all together]


‚ú¶ Earn more for web content

Pro-looking, clean copy decks that mock the website wireframe? Instant 5x the rate.

üí∞ Dress your copy decks to impress and charge more for them

üìê

More importantly, WRITE great work ‚Äî the storytelling comes from us, the writers.


‚òùÔ∏è Dev or designer? Read here!

While Pipewriter is meant for writers, some designers loved using it for quick proto. And if you work in Figma, SvelteKit, React and more, the upcoming webapp will make it easy squeezy to export to these.

The idea is: prototyping

üîó Storyframing on UXDesign.cc ->


[before/after]

Kick it off and start

üî• BONUS: Docs Templates to Kickstart Your Genius

  1. SaaS landing page (so hot right now)
  2. Dark mode SEO landing page (for the cool kids)
  3. Company homepage (impress the suits)


Preview sample page

‚ú¶ Words are the First Prototype

The best websites don't start start with design, they start with copy.


[logos]


‚ú¶ Support webapp dev

If "prototying by typing" appeals to you & you think writers should get a louder voice in product design, support this up as I keep building the webapp.
products.custom_summary: 10x your copy decks with an app that lives in Docs Sidebar. Made for writers who care about UX.
